item.title: Report E-2025050422
item.description:
Report E-2025050422

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: WASHINGTON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR RANGER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On May 15, 2025, at 1215 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Washington, MO regarding the release of Ethanol. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 275.0 gallons of Ethanol (UN1170, 3, II) from (1) 270-gal poy tote and (1) 5-gal plastic pail onto asphalt and the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to a load shift as the tote slid into a pallet, impacting the trailer floor and a 1’ x 2’ area of asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Damaged pails of product were overpacked in a flex bin by the contractors to leave with the consignee and send back to the shipper. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DGs which were taken off-site by the contractor pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025050511
item.description:
Report X-2025050511

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Trailer arrived to 003 and when the trailer was opened it was discovered that there were pails scattered across the rear of the trailer. The box the containers were in shifted in transit. The containers did not appear to be significantly damaged but there were small piles of powder scattered around the floor of the trailer. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation. Crews located approximately 1/4 cup of UN3378 released to the trailer floor. There were no damaged containers and crews determined product had spilled due to load shift. Hand tools were utilized to remove free-standing product. All waste collected and containerized into one (1) five-gallon pail for disposal. Zachary Branstetter approved of clean up.

item.title: Report X-2025050629
item.description:
Report X-2025050629

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A GROUP OF PACKAGES THAT WERE WET FROM RAINWATER, AND AMONG THEM A FULLY REGULATED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WERE DISCOVERED BY THE SWEEPER IN UNLOAD-E. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE HAZ-MAT WAS CONTAINED AND SEGREGATED, WITH THE CARTON SHOWING WETTNESS, BUT NO SIGNS OF SPILLAGE, THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 POLY 1-LB CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY A COUPLE OF ROTATIONS, CAUSING A COUPLE OF OUNCES OF THE PRODUCT TO LEAK OUT OF THE BREACH AND REMAIN CONFINED INTERNALLY IN THE BASE OF THE CARTON. THE PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF 2" OR MORE OF KRAFT PAPER AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 32 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2025051219
item.description:
Report X-2025051219

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CURA: On May 1, 2025, at approximately 9:00 AM CDT, a crew from EWI arrived on-site. Following a site assessment, EWI personnel noted (12) damaged 16-oz cans of UN 1993. Three (3) were opened and nine (9) had dents. EWI personnel collected the (12) damaged 16-oz cans and impacted cardboard box conta inerized them in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The released product had not impacted any other freight. All UN 1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and left on-site for future terminal disposal. EWI personnel noted no further action required on-site and crews de mobilized.

item.title: Report X-2025050490
item.description:
Report X-2025050490

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO OF DELAWARE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN LOADER ON THE PD-2. HE NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISER, WHO CONTACTED THE DMP. WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 1 GLASS, 2.5 LITER BOTTLE WAS LOOSE BY A COUPLE OF ROTATIONS, CAUSING THE LIQUID TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO AN INTERNAL PLASTIC BAG AND SIDE WALL OF THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING CONSISTED OF MOLDED FIBERBOARD AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL BIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2025050386
item.description:
Report X-2025050386

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS OBSERVED AS WET BY SUPERVISOR. HAZMAT RESPONDER WAS CALLED ON TO REPORT TO WET PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP WORK AREA. UPON INSPECTION, RESPONDER OBSERVED THAT CAP WAS LOOSE ON A PLASTIC CONTAINER RESULTING IN SPILLAGE. CONTENTS WERE PROCESSED FOLLOWING DMP/DMN PROCEDURES WITHOUT INCIDENT.

item.title: Report E-2025050272
item.description:
Report E-2025050272

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: t 09:30 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (XSL) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a pallet puncture, approximately .5 gallon of Eliminator HB Polyester Primer (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor and has absorbed. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and damaged can will be placed into a 30 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release.

item.title: Report E-2025050265
item.description:
Report E-2025050265

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: SIKESTON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050195
item.description:
Report E-2025050195

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-10
  • City: GRANDVIEW
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifty-five (55) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon plastic drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the drum being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. One (1) 85-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the damaged drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050027
item.description:
Report E-2025050027

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 04:28 EDT on 4/3, XPO-XSL contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 20 gallons of "SETALUX 10-1302" from a 55-gallon metal drum onto the trailer floor. The drum was punctured by a forklift at XSL. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor to assist with additional PPE, citing goggles. The caller declined assistance. ERTS generated waste ID: 232675-1
